title: Help! "All major credit cards accepted"
content:
Can any one help to id this font   
   
It seem to me like helvetica or oter generic sans serif. It looks like its weight is black.   
   
It looks like it has pieces chopped off in geometric lines.   
 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20071031054615im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/32565.jpg)

 [‹ Lacrimosa font](http://web.archive.org/web/20071031054615/http:/www.typophile.com/node/4025 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) Classic scents - Clarendon {Franz} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20071031054615/http:/www.typophile.com/node/4097 "Go to next forum topic")
author: orb

comments.content: I'd say they used [Helvetica Black](http://web.archive.org/web/20071031054615/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/neue-helvetica/helvetica-95-black/testdrive.html?s=All%2Bmajor%2Bcards%2Baccepted&p=36) and did some cutting and trimming on their own. However, that doesn't mean this doesn't exist as it's own typeface, the nineties were so wacky that way.

It reminds me of something that I've seen before. Maybe from the FontShop Fuse collections? Somewhere between Barry Deck's [Caustic Biomorph](http://web.archive.org/web/20071031054615/http:/fontshop.com/virtual/fssf/products/fuse04.htm) and Neville Brody's [FF Dirty Six One](http://web.archive.org/web/20071031054615/http:/fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=catalog.fontdisplay&displayfontid=FF.8501.0.0).   
   
More likely freeware, I suppose.

Neville Brody's [F State](http://web.archive.org/web/20071031054615/http:/fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=virtual.content&area=sf_products&content=/virtual/fssf/products/fuse01.htm) is an intercut Grotesque,   
while GarageFonts had some similar stuff too.   
Gimmeaminnit.

Yep, International Disgrace is another one of Rodney   
Shelden Fehsenfeld's fonts that disappeared from the   
GarageFonts catalogue. Not even a sample on Identifont.   
 ![:-(](http://web.archive.org/web/20071031054615im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/clipart/sad.gif)
